DropDown.tooltip: Provisioning Type active on the server

NumberSpinner.tooltip: Threshold used for low SPT number alarm to obtain SPT Numbers from providers

NumberSpinner.name: numProvThreshold
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Threshold used for provisioning to obtain SPT Numbers from providers

NumberSpinner.name: numProvTimeout
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Amount of hours unsubmitted provisioning request is active

DropDown.name: cmbNotifTypes
DropDown.tooltip: Notification Type active on the server

NumberSpinner.name: numResendNotif
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of retry attempts to resend Notification after an error.\s*Enter 0 to not resend Notification on error.

CheckBox.name: chkAllowRework
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates decommissioning of object being part of successful notification is allowed

NumberSpinner.name: numDefaultLotSize
NumberSpinner.tooltip: This value determines the initial block size of numbers to allocate at Lot Start.\s*This field is provided for backward compatibility below version 7.36.000

NumberSpinner.name: numLoginTimeout
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of minutes before an idle login is logged out.\s*Enter 0 for no timeout limit.

Label.name: lblSMTPDesc
Label.value: Use this page to configure the Database Mail account that SQL Server uses to send e-mail to an SMTP server

TextBox.name: txtDmasAccount
TextBox.tooltip: Name of the account

TextBox.name: txtDmasDesc
TextBox.tooltip: Description of the account

CheckBox.name: chkAuthenticate
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates Basic Authentication is required.\s*No checkmark indicates no SMTP authentication is required.

TextBox.name: txtSbaUser
TextBox.tooltip: User name that Database Mail uses to log in to the SMTP server

TextBox.name: txtOmsEmail
TextBox.tooltip: Name of the e-mail address for the account. \s*This is the e-mail address that e-mail is sent from.

TextBox.name: txtOmsDisplay
TextBox.tooltip: Name to be displayed on messages sent from the account

TextBox.name: txtOmsServer
TextBox.tooltip: Name or IP address of the SMTP server the account uses to send e-mail

GroupBox.name: grpSsa
GroupBox.value: SQL Server Authentication (Required to save this page)

TextBox.name: txtSsaUser
TextBox.tooltip: Name of a SQL Server account assigned to sysadmin Server Role.\s*An administrative account is required to save this configuration to SQL Server Database Mail.

TextBox.name: txtSsaPwd
TextBox.tooltip: Password of the SQL Server account.\s*This password is required to save this configuration to SQL Server Database Mail.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: This screen is used to enable Guardian-to-Guardian services on this Guardian server and to configure this server for Guardian-to-Guardian data transfers. A drop box can be located locally on this server or on a remote STFP server.

CheckBox.name: chkEnableG2G
CheckBox.tooltip: Status of G2G data transfer services on this Guardian server.\s*A checkmark indicates Guardian-to-Guardian data transfer services are enabled on this server.

TextBox.name: txtName
TextBox.tooltip: Enter a user friendly G2G name for this Guardian G2G server

TextBox.name: txtVersion
TextBox.tooltip: Version of Guardian SPT on this server

NumberSpinner.name: numRetryImport
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Immediate Import Retries on receipt of G2G Request.\s*Enter the number of retries at importing G2G data that are required before attempts to import cease.Range: 0 to 10

TextBox.name: txtG2GDescription
TextBox.tooltip: Enter a user friendly description for this Guardian G2G server

TextBox.name: txtFolder
TextBox.tooltip: Enter the path to a root folder on the local file system where local G2G data may be processedor use the Browse button to the right to locate the root folder.\s*This root folder must have two subfolders named DropBox and Archive.\s*If the root folder or subfolders do not exist they will automatically be created.

Button.name: btnBrowse
Button.tooltip: Browse to the local working folder

RadioButton.name: rdoLocal
RadioButton.tooltip: Local drop box.Select this option if the drop box is located on this Guardian server.

RadioButton.name: rdoRemote
RadioButton.tooltip: Remote drop box.Select this option if the drop box is located on a remote SFTP server.

NumberSpinner.name: numInterval
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of seconds to wait before checking for Reply and Request messages.Enter the number of seconds to wait between polling intervals.\s*Range: 30 to 14400 seconds\s*NOTE: After this value is changed, the Wndows service Systech G2G Message Monitor should be restarted in order for the change to take affect.

TextBox.name: txtSiteURL
TextBox.tooltip: SFTP host URL

NumberSpinner.name: numPort
NumberSpinner.tooltip: SFTP port

TextBox.name: txtUser
TextBox.tooltip: SFTP user name

TextBox.name: txtPassword
TextBox.tooltip: SFTP password

TextBox.name: txtSubDir
TextBox.tooltip: Optional sub directory below the root to be used as the dropbox

Label.name: lblDescription

Button.name: btnPickup
Button.tooltip: Configure pickup location for packaging order files

TextBox.name: txtFolder
TextBox.tooltip: Location to find new packaging orders

TextBox.name: txtArchive
TextBox.tooltip: Location to archive completed packaging orders (optional)

TextBox.name: txtPrefix
TextBox.tooltip: Prefix of files that are packaging orders (optional)

TextBox.name: txtSuffix
TextBox.tooltip: Suffix of files that are packaging orders (optional)

TextBox.name: txtExt
TextBox.tooltip: File extension of packaging order files

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: This screen is used to enable or disable the applications logs. Application logs are used for diagnostic and troubleshooting purposes only. These logs do not affect production data history. For improved performance it is recommended to use the auto-purge option; purged records are not archived.

CheckBox.name: chkErrorLogOn
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates errors will be logged

CheckBox.name: chkErrorLogPurge
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates the log history will automatically be purged after the specified number of days.\s*No checkmark indicates the log history will be preserved.

NumberSpinner.name: numErrorPurge
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Enter number of days to keep error log history.\s*Errors older than the number entered will be automatically purged.

CheckBox.name: chkEventLogOn
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates events will be logged

CheckBox.name: chkEventLogPurge
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates the log history will automatically be purged after the specified number of days.\s*No checkmark indicates the log history will be preserved.

NumberSpinner.name: numEventPurge
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Enter number of days to keep event log history.\s*Events older than the number entered will be automatically purged.

Label.name: lblDescription

RadioButton.tooltip: Show events for a given date range

Button.tooltip: Display the row information in a dialog window

Button.name: btnExport
Button.tooltip: Export row information to a XML file, starting with the selected row

NumberSpinner.name: numExportRows
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of rows to export

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: This operation is provided as an aid to move approved configurations from one Guardian to another Guardian. The export operation will create a file that can be imported into another Guardian at the same software version. The export operation is intended to assist with the moving configurations between Guardian servers and is not intended as a disaster recovery method. Only configuration data is exported - production and historical data are not included.

TextBox.name: txtFile
TextBox.tooltip: Be sure to select a file location that is accessible by all machines

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: The import process requires System Administration privileges on the SQL Server database. Please enter an SQL Server account that has System Administration privileges.

Label.name: lblDescription2
Label.value: This operation is provided as an aid to move approved configurations from one Guardian to another Guardian. The import operation will only accept exported configurations from a source Guardian that is at the same software version as the destination Guardian. During the import process a backup configuration file will be created. The backup process will prompt to overwrite for each import and is only intended as a means to rollback the current import operation.

TextBox.name: txtImportFile
TextBox.tooltip: Be sure to select a file location that is accessible by all machines

TreeView.name: trvwImport
TreeView.tooltip: This is the SPT Configuration from the import file.

TreeView.name: trvwExisting
TreeView.tooltip: This is the existing SPT Configuration.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Each step follows the workflow for transfering a Lot.

Label.name: lblDescTab1
Label.value: Select the Lots to transfer from the list of available closed Lots.

Button.name: btnStart
Button.tooltip: Add to queue and begin transfer

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Each step follows the workflow for transfering a Lot.

Label.name: lblDescTab2
Label.value: View requests in the transfer queue pending initial processing.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Each step follows the workflow for transfering a Lot.

Label.name: lblDescTab3
Label.value: View Lots in local Guardian History

RadioButton.name: rdoLocalHist
RadioButton.tooltip: Display lots moved to local Guardian History.\s*These lots have successfully moved from the real-time database to Guardian History.

RadioButton.name: rdoLocalFailed
RadioButton.tooltip: Display lots that failed to move from the real-time database to Guardian History

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Each step follows the workflow for transfering a Lot.

Label.name: lblDescTab3
Label.value: View Lots in local Guardian History

RadioButton.name: rdoLocalHist
RadioButton.tooltip: Display lots moved to local Guardian History.\s*These lots have successfully moved from the real-time database to Guardian History.

RadioButton.name: rdoLocalFailed
RadioButton.tooltip: Display lots that failed to move from the real-time database to Guardian History

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Status descriptions defined here are used in the configuration of the IPS workflows. Auto-Decommissioning will decommission SPT items with the specified status at the end of the packaging lot.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Packaging levels are defined here and used during configuration of the product hierarchy for individual products. For example, a bottle is a part of a bundle; a bundle is a part of a case; a case is a part of a pallet. Define the object types used for a product.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Manual decommissioning reasons are defined here and appear in the manual rework applications.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Notifications Rules enable the ability to send serialized data to enterprise systems. Rules specify the XML schema, XML parameters, transport protocol and notification trigger method.

TextBox.name: txtName
TextBox.tooltip: Name of the notification rule.\s*This can be the vendor that will receive the notification.

DropDown.name: cmbProcessor
DropDown.tooltip: Processor used for the notification. This is the software module written by Systech that transmits the data.

NumberSpinner.name: cmbnumTimeout
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of seconds a Notification may be pending before a timeout occurs

TextBox.name: txtNotificationSchema
TextBox.tooltip: Database procedure to collect data or update data.

DropDown.name: cmbProtocalType
DropDown.tooltip: Protocol used to communicate with the destination

NumberSpinner.name: cmbnumRetry
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Immediate retries on error for Notification.\s*The value displayed indicates the number of retries at communication that are required before attempts to communicate cease.

DropDown.name: cmbTransform
DropDown.tooltip: Active Transformation overrides the default transformation

Button.name: btnCommunication
Button.tooltip: Edit connection information for specified process

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: \s*Provisioning Rules enable the ability to request and receive serialized numbers from enterprise systems.\s*Rules specify the XML schema, XML parameters and transport protocol used to make the request.\s*

TextBox.name: txtName
TextBox.tooltip: \s*Name of the provisioning rule.\s*This can be the vendor that will provision serial numbers.\s*

DropDown.name: cmbProcessor
DropDown.tooltip: \s*Processor used for the provisioning.\s*This is the software module written by Systech that transmits the request for data.\s*

CheckBox.name: chkActive
CheckBox.tooltip: \s*Status of the provisioning rule.\s*A checkmark indicates the rule is active.\s*

DropDown.name: cmbProtocalType
DropDown.tooltip: Protocol used to communicate with the destination

CheckBox.name: chkEnablePreProcessing
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates preprocessing of SPT numbers is enabled

Button.name: btnCommunication
Button.tooltip: Configure connection information for specified process.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: \s*The Manufacturers screen is used to configure the various manufacturers producing products on the Advisor lines connected to the Guardian system.\s*

TextBox.name: txtName
TextBox.tooltip: Company / Manufacturer Name

TextBox.name: txtCmpPrfx
TextBox.tooltip: Company / Manufacturer Prefix assigned by GS1

TextBox.name: txtProductClass
TextBox.tooltip: Default Product ID Type for this Manufacturer

TextBox.name: txtNotifProdClass
TextBox.tooltip: Default Notification ID Type for this Manufacturer

DropDown.name: cmbProvisioning
DropDown.tooltip: Provisioning Rule assigned to this Manufacturer / Company.

TextBox.name: txtSiteId
TextBox.tooltip: Identification assigned by the provisioning service for this system, site or server

Button.name: btnMetadata
Button.tooltip: Configure additional provisioning request metadata keys.

Button.name: btnSelect/Sequence
Button.tooltip: Assign and reorder Notification Rules for this Manufacturer / Company.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: \s*The Manufacturers screen is used to configure the various manufacturers producing products on the Advisor lines connected to the Guardian system.\s*

TextBox.name: txtCmpPrfx
TextBox.xtooltip: Company / Manufacturer Prefix assigned by GS1

TextBox.name: txtProductClass
TextBox.xtooltip: Default Product ID Type for this Manufacturer

TextBox.name: txtNotifProdClass
TextBox.xtooltip: Default Notification ID Type for this Manufacturer

DropDown.name: cmbProvisioning
DropDown.tooltip: Provisioning Rule assigned to this Manufacturer / Company.

TextBox.name: txtSiteId
TextBox.tooltip: Identification assigned by the provisioning service for this system, site or server

Button.name: btnMetadata
Button.tooltip: Configure additional provisioning request metadata keys.

Button.name: btnSelect/Sequence
Button.tooltip: Assign and reorder Notification Rules for this Manufacturer / Company.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: \s*Manual Tab: Used for manual product configuration.\s*Master Data Tab: Used to manage products received from an enterprise system.\s*Master Data Templates Tab: Used to create templates for use with Product Master Data imports.\s*

TextBox.name: txtProductName
TextBox.tooltip: A name used in notifications

TextBox.name: txtDesc
TextBox.tooltip: A description used in notifications

DropDown.name: cmbManufacturer
DropDown.tooltip: List of manufacturers

TextBox.name: txtPrdCodeType
TextBox.tooltip: Product class type used in communication between Advisor and Guardian,\s*could be included in notification unless alternate specified\s*\(e.g. SKU, GTIN, NDC\)

TextBox.name: txtPrdCode
TextBox.tooltip: Product identifier value used in communication between Advisor and Guardian,\s*could be included in notification unless alternate specified

TextBox.name: txtNotPrdCodeType
TextBox.tooltip: Enter Notification Product ID Type.\s*This needs to be added only if different than Product ID Type or there is notification.

TextBox.name: txtNotPrdCode
TextBox.tooltip: Enter Notification Product ID.\s*This needs to be added only if different from Product ID or there is notification.

NumberSpinner.name: numTargetRate
NumberSpinner.toottip: Estimated parts per minute target rate.

CheckBox.name: chkOverrideTargetRate
CheckBox.tooltip: When checked, allows the transfer size to be set directly.\s*When unchecked, target rate is used to calculate transfer size.\s*Transfer Size is used to improve transfer rates and reduce network traffic by grouping items into a bulk transfer.

CheckBox.name: chkEnable
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates the product is enabled and can be used \(produced\) by the system.

CheckBox.name: chkAllowOrphans
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates notifications of commissioned SPT items that are not aggregated are allowed.\s*Some EPCIS systems, such as IBM, accept notifications of SPT items that are not aggregated to a parent.\s*When checking this box, this implies the EPCIS system accepts notifications that are orphaned.

CheckBox.name: chkTriggerTransferonCommissioning
CheckBox.value: Trigger Transfer on Commissioning of Top Object
CheckBox.tooltip: The check box is used to allow the transfer to occur when the highest line level SPT object is commissioned.\s*This transfer occurs regardless of the number of SPT items in the transfer queue.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: \s*Manual Tab: Used for manual product configuration.\s*Master Data Tab: Used to manage products received from an enterprise system.\s*Master Data Templates Tab: Used to create templates for use with Product Master Data imports.\s*

CheckBox.name: chkTriggerTransferonCommissioning
CheckBox.value: Trigger Transfer on Commissioning of Top Object

Button.tooltip: Configure pickup location of Master Data files

Label.value: Failed Notifications Tab: Used to resend failed notifications in their entirety.\s*Initial Notifications Tab: Used to trigger a new notification.\s*Successful Notifications Tab: Used to resend previous notifications.

DropDown.tooltip: Product list is presented based on selected Manufacturer

Button.tooltip: Request new block of numbers from provisioning provider

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Manually enter a range of serial numbers.

DropDown.tooltip: Select desired manufacturer

DropDown.tooltip: Product list is presented based on selected Manufacturer

DropDown.tooltip: List of available SPT formats

TextBox.name: txtStartSPT
TextBox.tooltip: First SPT number in the block

TextBox.tooltip: Last SPT number in the block

RadioButton.name: rdoQuantity
RadioButton.tooltip: Select this option to generate End SPT Number for the quantity entered

RadioButton.name: rdoEndSPT
RadioButton.tooltip: Select this option to enter End SPT Number.\s*The quantity within the range entered will be calculated.

TextBox.name: txtQuantity
TextBox.tooltip: Amount of SPT Numbers in the block

DropDown.name: cmbInputFormat
DropDown.tooltip: The SPT number format that is entered in the text boxes

Button.name: btnImport
Button.tooltip: Import SPT Numbers from a file of provisioned numbers

Button.name: btnSave
Button.tooltip: Load specified block of numbers into database

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: This screen is used to configure and import a random list of SPT Numbers that are organized on preprinted label reels.

Button.name: btnConfig
Button.tooltip: Configure HTTP parameters for automated Label Reel import

TextBox.name: txtSiteName
TextBox.tooltip: Enter a name for the configuration

TextBox.name: txtUrl
TextBox.tooltip: Enter a URL for the HTTP listener

NumberSpinner.name: numPort
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Enter a port for the HTTP listener

TextBox.name: txtUser
TextBox.tooltip: This user id is sent to the Url:Port when Basic authentication is used

TextBox.name: txtPwd
TextBox.tooltip: This password is sent to the Url:Port when Basic authentication is used

TextBox.name: txtArchive
TextBox.tooltip: Enter a path to the archive folder

CheckBox.name: chkArchive
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates message archiving is enabled

CheckBox.name: chkIgnoreExceptions
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates any error in receiving an HTTP response will be ignored.\s*It is recommended this option is enabled.

Label.name: lblTitleText
Label.value: Import China SFDA Random SPT Numbers

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: This screen is used to import a random list of SPT Numbers for SFDA provisioning.

TextBox.name: txtPath
TextBox.tooltip: Enter the full path and filename of the import file\s*or use the Browse button to browse and locate the file.

TextBox.name: txtImportResource
TextBox.tooltip: Code Resource Product Code found in the file

TextBox.name: txtImportSubclass
TextBox.tooltip: Subclass Number found in the file

TextBox.name: txtImportProduct
TextBox.tooltip: Product name found in the file

TextBox.name: txtImportPackaging
TextBox.tooltip: Packaging specification found in the file

TextBox.name: txtImportCapacity
TextBox.tooltip: Packaging ratio found in the file

NumberSpinner.name: numRange
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Amount of SPT numbers expected to be in the file

NumberSpinner.name: numAmount
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Amount of SPT numbers found in the file

TextBox.name: txtProductCode
TextBox.tooltip: Product Code from matching Product

TextBox.name: txtProductClassId
TextBox.tooltip: Product Class Id from matching Product

TextBox.name: txtProductDesc
TextBox.tooltip: Product Description from matching Product

TextBox.name: txtPackagingLevel
TextBox.tooltip: Packaging Level from matching Product

TextBox.name: txtCapacity
TextBox.tooltip: Capacity from matching Product

DropDown.tooltip: Select a format

Label.value: Label Definitions for Web Service Printing\s*

GS1/SER Single Item Commissioning Notification Schema

DropDown.tooltip: Select a parameter name

TextBox.name: txtValue
TextBox.tooltip: Enter the parameter value

DropDown.name: cmbSelect
DropDown.tooltip: Select a parameter value

MultilineTextBox.name: edtInfo
MultilineTextBox.value: Valid mask characters:\s*yyyy or yy - Year\s*MM - Month\s*dd - Day\s*HH - Hours\s*mm - Minutes\s*ss - Seconds\s*fff - Milliseconds\s*Valid special characters:\s*- \+ / \* \( \) \[ \] < > { } \| : ; , . _

TextBox.name: txtUrl
TextBox.tooltip: The maximum length of this URL is up to 1000 characters long

TextBox.name: txtSiteUrl
TextBox.tooltip: The maximum length of this URL is up to 1000 characters long

TextBox.name: txtSiteUrl
TextBox.tooltip: The maximum length of this URL is up to 1000 characters long

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Configure the provisioning details for each SPT Format applicable at this packaging level.

TextBox.name: txtEncoding
TextBox.tooltip: Requested encoding type for the numbers to be provisioned

TextBox.name: txtIDType
TextBox.tooltip: IDType assigned by SAP

TextBox.name: txtKeyName
TextBox.tooltip: Identifier name used to identify the product/packaging level for the request

TextBox.name: txtKeyValue
TextBox.tooltip: Identifier value that uniquely identifies the product/packaging level for the request

NumberSpinner.name: numRequestSize
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Amount of SPT Numbers to request from the provisioning provider

NumberSpinner.name: numThreshold
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Threshold used for provisioning to obtain SPT Numbers from the provider

NumberSpinner.name: numAlarm
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Threshold used for low SPT Number alarm to obtain SPT Numbers from the provider

NumberSpinner.name: numSPTLength
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Required length of each SPT Number.\s*Enter 0 if there are no requirements.

CheckBox.name: chkPreEncoded
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates pre-encoded SPT Numbers will be used

CheckBox.name: chkOverlap
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates to check against existing SPT Number ranges.\s*Overlapping ranges or lower ranges will not be accepted.

CheckBox.name: chkDisableNonSerialCheck
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates verification of the non-Serial Number segment of the SPT Number will be disabled.\s*No checkmark indicates the non-Serial Number segment of the SPT Number will be verified.

WebServices.TagSerialManager.value: Communication: Web Services. Tag Serial Manager

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: \s*Manual Tab: Used for manual product configuration.\s*Master Data Tab: Used to manage products received from an enterprise system.\s*Master Data Templates Tab: Used to create templates for use with Product Master Data imports.\s*

DropDown.name: cmbMan
DropDown.tooltip: List of manufacturers

CheckBox.name: chkActive
CheckBox.tooltip: Check mark means the product is active \(checked\) and no check mark means the product is inactive \(unchecked\).\s*When the product is active it can be used \(produced\) by the system \(it is enabled\).\s*It cannot be used \(produced\) by the system when inactive \(not enabled\).\s*

CheckBox.name: chkAllowOrphans
CheckBox.tooltip: The check box, “Allow Orphans” is used to allow notifications of commissioned SPT items that are not aggregated.\s*Some EPCIS systems, such as IBM, accept notifications of SPT items that are not aggregated to a parent.\s*When checking this box, this implies the EPCIS system accepts notifications that are orphaned.

TextBox.name: txtPrdName
TextBox.tooltip: Product name, used in notification

TextBox.name: txtDesc
TextBox.tooltip: Product Description, used in notification

TextBox.name: txtPrdCodeType
TextBox.tooltip: Product class name used in communication between Advisor and Guardian,\s*could be included in notification unless alternate specified\s*\(e.g. SKU, GTIN, NDC\)

TextBox.name: txtPrdCode
TextBox.tooltip: Product class value used in communication between Advisor and Guardian, could be included in notification unless alternate specified

TextBox.name: txtNotPrdCodeType
TextBox.tooltip: Enter Notification ID Type.\s*This needs to be added only if different than Product ID Type or there is notification.\s*

TextBox.name: txtNotPrdCode
TextBox.tooltip: Enter Notification ID.\s*This needs to be added only if different from Product ID or there is notification.\s*

NumberSpinner.name: numTargetRate
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Estimated parts per minute target rate

NumberSpinner.name: numTransferSize
NumberSpinner.tooltip: The number of items placed into the transfer queue before an actual transfer to Guardian is attempted while the lot is running.\s*It is used to improve transfer rates and reduce network traffic by grouping items into a bulk transfer.\s*

CheckBox.name: chkLeafIsContainer
CheckBox.tooltip: When checked, allows the transfer size to be set directly.\s*When unchecked, target rate is used to calculate transfer size.\s*Transfer Size is used to improve transfer rates and reduce network traffic by grouping items into a bulk transfer.\s*

CheckBox.name: chkTrigger
CheckBox.value: Trigger Transfer on Commissioning of Top Object
CheckBox.tooltip: The check box is used to allow the transfer to occur when the highest line level SPT object is commissioned.\s*This transfer occurs regardless of the number of SPT items in the transfer queue.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Specify the Packaging hierarchy starting with the top parent level Package Item Type and working down to the lowest leaf level Package Item Type.

NumberSpinner.name: numThreshold
NumberSpinner.tooltip: This threshold causes Advisor to request the next set of SPT numbers from Guardian. When the amount of SPT numbers remaining at this level falls below this value, Advisor will request a block of numbers in accordance with the Refill Size. Range is 2% to 50%.

NumberSpinner.name: numCapacity
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of children in this packaging level.\s*Set to 0 for leaf level.

NumberSpinner.name: numRefillSize
NumberSpinner.tooltip: The amount of SPT numbers Advisor will request from Guardian when the amount of available SPT numbers falls below the Threshold

CheckBox.name: chkNotify
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates this packaging level will be used to trigger the in lot notification.\s*For example, sending notifications when pallets are processed.

CheckBox.name: chkPartial
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates this packaging level will allow to commission a container with fewer children than the capacity defined

CheckBox.name: chkUseSSCC
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates this packaging level will issue SSCC labels for partial shipments

CheckBox.name: chkSkipNotification
CheckBox.tooltip: Warning: By enabling this option this packaging level will not be included in any of the notifications generated regardless of the schema.\s*Note that not all schemas may support this option.

CheckBox.name: chkRandomization
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates this packaging level will randomly select SPT numbers from a block of numbers based on the randomization factor

CheckBox.name: chkPBL
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark enables Pack-By-Layer.\s*Capacity = Rows x Columns x Layers

NumberSpinner.name: numChildHeight
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Height (mm) of the child item when packed

NumberSpinner.name: numRows
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of rows in a layer.\s*Capacity = Rows x Columns x Layers

NumberSpinner.name: numColumns
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of columns in a layer.\s*Capacity = Rows x Columns x Layers

NumberSpinner.name: numLayers
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of layers in the container.\s*Capacity = Rows x Columns x Layers

NumberSpinner.name: numLength
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Interior length of the container

NumberSpinner.name: numWidth
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Interior width of the container

Button.name: btnProvisioning
Button.tooltip: Configure provisioning for this packaging level

Button.name: btnWizard
Button.tooltip: Step through packaging level wizard.\s*Used for quick entry of packaging levels.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: Specify the Packaging hierarchy starting with the top parent level Package Item Type and working down to the lowest leaf level Package Item Type.

NumberSpinner.name: numThreshold
NumberSpinner.tooltip: This threshold causes Advisor to request the next set of SPT numbers from Guardian. When the amount of SPT numbers remaining at this level falls below this value, Advisor will request a block of numbers in accordance with the Refill Size. Range is 2% to 50%.

NumberSpinner.name: numCapacity
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of children in this packaging level.\s*Set to 0 for leaf level.

NumberSpinner.name: numRefillSize
NumberSpinner.tooltip: The amount of SPT numbers Advisor will request from Guardian when the amount of available SPT numbers falls below the Threshold

CheckBox.name: chkNotify
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates this packaging level will be used to trigger the in lot notification.\s*For example, sending notifications when pallets are processed.

CheckBox.name: chkPartial
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates this packaging level will allow to commission a container with fewer children than the capacity defined

CheckBox.name: chkUseSSCC
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates this packaging level will issue SSCC labels for partial shipments

CheckBox.name: chkSkipNotification
CheckBox.tooltip: Warning: By enabling this option this packaging level will not be included in any of the notifications generated regardless of the schema.\s*Note that not all schemas may support this option.

CheckBox.name: chkRandomization
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark indicates this packaging level will randomly select SPT numbers from a block of numbers based on the randomization factor

CheckBox.name: chkPBL
CheckBox.tooltip: A checkmark enables Pack-By-Layer.\s*Capacity = Rows x Columns x Layers

NumberSpinner.name: numChildHeight
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Height \(mm\) of the child item when packed

NumberSpinner.name: numRows
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of rows in a layer.\s*Capacity = Rows x Columns x Layers

NumberSpinner.name: numColumns
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of columns in a layer.\s*Capacity = Rows x Columns x Layers

NumberSpinner.name: numLayers
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Number of layers in the container.\s*Capacity = Rows x Columns x Layers

NumberSpinner.name: numLength
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Interior length of the container

NumberSpinner.name: numWidth
NumberSpinner.tooltip: Interior width of the container

Button.name: btnProvisioning
Button.tooltip: Configure provisioning for this packaging level

Button.name: btnWizard
Button.tooltip: Step through packaging level wizard.\s*Used for quick entry of packaging levels.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: For Serialized Product Tracking, SPT, blocks of unique numbers are allocated to a production line. In this screen, we determine how the unique SPT numbers are allocated to a line.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: ERROR!\s*Purge production data is not allowed on Guardian: .*\s*while there are production lots in progress.\s*Press CANCEL to exit this function.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: WARNING!\s*You have selected to purge the production data from Guardian: .*\.\s*The configuration settings are not removed by this process.\s*This process cannot be reversed without restoring a Guardian database backup.\s*Press CANCEL now and make a backup of this Guardian database before continuing.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: WARNING!\s*Pressing PROCESS shall begin the purge operation on Guardian: .*\.\s*Once started, this operation cannot be stopped.\s*An event will be logged in the Audit Trail recording the\s*user, time and date of this action.\s*Provide login information and press PROCESS to proceed.\s*Press CANCEL to return to the main menu without purging the production data.

Label.name: lblRights
Label.value: The login must have sufficient access rights to purge data.

Label.name: lblInfo
Label.value: The user must also belong to the same domain as the Guardian server when using Windows authentication.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: WARNING!\s*Pressing PROCESS shall begin the purge operation on Guardian: .*\.\s*Once started, this operation cannot be stopped.\s*An event will be logged in the Audit Trail recording the\s*user, time and date of this action.\s*Provide login information and press PROCESS to proceed.\s*Press CANCEL to return to the main menu without purging the production data.

Label.name: lblRights
Label.value: The login must have sufficient access rights to purge data.

Label.name: lblInfo
Label.value: The user must also belong to the same domain as the Guardian server when using Windows authentication.

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: This operation is provided as an aid to move approved configurations from one Guardian to another Guardian. The export operation will create a file that can be imported into another Guardian at the same software version. The export operation is intended to assist with the moving configurations between Guardian servers and is not intended as a disaster recovery method. Only configuration data is exported - production and historical data are not included.\s*

TextBox.name: txtFile
TextBox.tooltip: Be sure to select a file location that is accessible by all machines

Label.name: lblDescription
Label.value: The import process requires System Administration privileges on the SQL Server database. Please enter an SQL Server account that has System Administration privileges.

Label.name: lblDescription2
Label.value: This operation is provided as an aid to move approved configurations from one Guardian to another Guardian. The import operation will only accept exported configurations from a source Guardian that is at the same software version as the destination Guardian. During the import process a backup configuration file will be created. The backup process will prompt to overwrite for each import and is only intended as a means to rollback the current import operation.

TextBox.name: txtImportFile
TextBox.tooltip: Be sure to select a file location that is accessible by all machines

TreeView.name: trvwImport
TreeView.tooltip: This is the SPT Configuration from the import file.

TreeView.name: trvwExisting
TreeView.tooltip: This is the existing SPT Configuration.
